definition: sugar-coated Chinese hawthorn or other fruit on a stick/tanghulu
sugar/sweets/candy/CL:顆|颗[ke1],塊|块[kuai4]
Allium scorodoprasum/bottle gourd
rush/reed/Phragmites communis
tanghulu/candied fruits on bamboo skewers dipped in sugar syrup, a common Chinese snack

sentences.english: The old man was wandering on the streets selling sugarcoated haws on sticks.
sentences.chinese: 賣冰糖葫蘆的老爺爺走街串巷地叫賣。

sentences.english: Nice color crystal-sugar berry , and one scene of the making progress.
sentences.chinese: 漂亮的糖葫蘆，還可以看到製作過程。

sentences.english: Candied-haws looks sweet and cute, but inside, it is hardy, sour and astringent.
sentences.chinese: 糖葫蘆的表面甜美可人，但內核卻是堅硬酸澀的。

sentences.english: Ah, I know Tanghulu. It is made of haws.
sentences.chinese: 啊，我知道糖葫蘆，就是那種包。

sentences.english: Hot pot, Beijing roast duck, tomatoes on sticks Peking noodles, and so on…
sentences.chinese: 火鍋，北京烤鴨，糖葫蘆，炸醬麪等等。

sentences.english: We are now looking at the photo is the candied fruit .
sentences.chinese: 大家現在看的這幅圖片是糖葫蘆。

sentences.english: Controlled the air conditioning button which on the stage arranged in turn to let me associate the candied fruit.
sentences.chinese: 中控臺上依次排列的空調按鈕讓我聯想起了糖葫蘆。

sentences.english: Your can buy sugar-coated haws on a stick in the Chinatown.
sentences.chinese: 你們可以在唐人街買到糖葫蘆。

sentences.english: The old man is selling sirupy calabashes.
sentences.chinese: 河南洛陽賣糖葫蘆的老漢。

definition: tanghulu/candied fruits on bamboo skewers dipped in sugar syrup, a common Chinese snack
shumai (shao mai) steamed dumpling/also written 燒賣|烧卖[shao1 mai4]
soft mixed vegetable and meat roll-up
jelly snack made by kneading jelly fig seeds 愛玉子|爱玉子[ai4 yu4 zi3] in water and combining with flavorings (popular in Taiwan and Singapore)
imagawayaki (sweet snack made of batter cooked in the shape of a car wheel, stuffed with azuki bean paste or other fillings)
steamed bun
large round baked wheat pancake
gluttonous/ravenous
food preserved in sugar or honey
carambola/star fruit
soft candy (gummi candy, gumdrop, jellybean etc)
kimchi/Korean pickled cabbage
bakery/CL:家[jia1]
ta-a noodles or danzai noodles, popular snack originating from Tainan
aorta (ingredient of hotpot, Sichuan cuisine)
hot pot containing stinky tofu and other ingredients (Taiwanese dish)
